p: All 98 representative strains selected from different groups according to their patterns in 16S rRNA PCR-RFLP, SDS-PAGE protein and BOX-PCR profiles ( Table 1 and Liu et al., 2012) formed nodules on M. pudica. Cross-inoculation studies showed that only the invasive mimosoid legume, L. leucocephala could nodulate with all five test strains ( Paraburkholderia spp. SWF66044, SWF66029, C. taiwanensis SWF66166, SWF66194, and SWF66322), which is in keeping with its neotropical origin, close relatedness to Mimosa, and its known promiscuity.
